page.title: 01RESUME OF D BLOCK 04280438
page.content: Situated approximately 5 km from the centre extending to the northern fringe of the city,this is a mainly middle class residential area well served by public transport and having many local amenities and recreational facilities. The population has a large Jewish community and a Catholic community. These 2 religious groups have built churches and schools within the area.There is a growing Asian community. Moortown contains one of the two hospices in the city,and situated on the Ring Road,one of the most successful chain stores in the country. Although now free from industry this area offers industrial archeological interest along the Meanwood Valley Trail.
